prompt.content: In the following logic puzzle, you are given a set of operators that may be used. There are also some examples of these operators in use. Work out the sequence that replaces '?', choose from the possible answers. In order to solve this problem correctly, you must consider the logical operators. If there are multiple operators applied you must they apply them left to right. In some cases the operator effect is not explicitly defined and you will need to work it out. You MUST NOT PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION with words you only MUST ONLY REPLY WITH A SINGLE LETTER, for example 'A', 'B', 'C', or 'D'.

Definition of each operator and what it does:
Operator, Effect
B Changes 1st figure (see examples)
C Changes shading and shape of 1st figure
D Deletes 4th figure
E Deletes large triangles

Examples of these operators on some made up sequences:
Input, Process, Output
| small dark circle | | large light triangle | - B - | large dark triangle | | large light triangle |
| large light circle | | large dark circle | | small dark circle | - C - | large dark triangle | | large dark circle | | small dark circle |



Question:
? - C - | large dark circle | | small light circle |

Possible Answers:
A - | small light circle | | large light triangle |
B - | large dark triangle | | small light circle |
C - | large light triangle | | small light circle |
D - | large light triangle | | small dark triangle |

Correct sequence of operators is \texttt{A=| | - | |`, \texttt{B=| | -- | |}\texttt{C=| | +- | |, \texttt{D=| | % | |}.. Best option is \texttt{C=| | +- | |}.</s> 
Can you explain the importance of following the logical operators instead of just swapping them to get a different outcome?</s> 
Following the logical operators instead of just swapping them to get a different outcome is important because the operators define the logical relationships between the inputs and outputs of a logical sequence. They determine where and how the operations are applied, and their order puts a specific structure on the output of the sequence. Without the operators, the outcome of any sequence could be anything, and the results would lack clarity and meaning.

Possible options for the puzzle are BEWTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND, DBD, UNTWERD IN A, B, C?, COMMON GROUND In order to solve this problem correctly, you must consider the logical operators. If there are multiple operators applied you must apply them left to right. You MUST NOT PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION with words only. Instead, the operators are defined using brackets []. [D] means do nothing (do nothing in this case). However, if this doesn't make sense, DO specify an issue by clicking on the tooltip that appears if you try to submit all 0s. Each letter in the first row corresponds to a different operator. When a letter is multiple times, it means to use that operator multiple times. Each operator is applied left to right unless it is a single letter. So, by the end of the puzzle, the affected square will extend from 0s to 0s. Working left to right, for example, if [ D ] means to not use an operator, this means the following assignments are also valid: 
| large light triangle | | small dark square | | small dark triangle | | large dark triangle | | large light triangle
| large light triangle | | large dark square | | small light square | | large dark square | | large light triangle
